title: Content
content:
The Content data can be imported into your instance of Service Management. The Content menu option (under Administration > Utilities > Data Deployment) appears only if you have the Tenant Admin role.

Unlike Sample Data, which is for demonstration and testing purposes, the Content data is aimed to ready your Service Management for real-world business needs. A solution powerful as Enterprise Service Management (ESM) has delicate designs and features to sustain various ecosystems within an enterprise. For example, besides the traditional IT Service Management, Human Resource Service Management and Enterprise Asset Management are basic and essential systems that can be empowered by ESM. However, building up the whole data model from scratch can be overwhelming and you may not know where to start with. That's when the Content data comes in handy.  

On the CONTENT tab of Data Deployment, you can select a category in the Category pane, and then click Deploy. The following types of data will be imported based on the selected category:

Human Resources:

  • Actual Services
  • Record Categories
  • Company
  • Asset Models
  • Groups
  • Categories
  • Service Definitions
  • Offerings
  • Surveys
  • Reports
  • Dashboard Definitions
  • Smart Virtual Agent Intents

Enterprise Assets:

  • Locations
  • Stockrooms
  • Enterprise Asset Subtypes
  • Asset Models
  • Enterprise Assets

Legal Services:

  • Categories
  • Service Definitions
  • Offerings

Financial Services:

  • Categories
  • Service Definitions
  • Offerings

Facility and Security Services:

  • Categories
  • Service Definitions
  • Offerings

Supply Chain and Procurement Services:

  • Categories
  • Service Definitions
  • Offerings
The Content data can't be undeployed once done. You can delete individual pieces of data, but you can't reverse the data deployment. In addition, if you try to deploy the same content the second time, a warning message pops up and advises you not to.
